duties_responsibilities.duty: Act as an Owner's Representative on healthcare construction programs from design through closeout.
Integrate company's best practices related to project delivery, budget, schedule, quality, and operations in the healthcare environment.
Advise and liaise with client, user groups, design team, contractors, and facility engineering representatives.
Support traditional Design-Bid-Build and Design/Build contracts with services such as scheduling, progress meetings, issue resolution, and testing and inspection.
Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal jurisdiction requirements, and understand and assess construction contract documents, building codes, and budgeting and scheduling.
Collaborate and integrate with other professionals, and have experience with Healthcare and Federal projects.
Possess knowledge of engineering services, licensing, and certifications such as CCM, PMP, and engineering licenses.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor of Electrical Engineering from an accredited school of higher education.
Minimum 4 years of experience in both design and construction.
Working knowledge of engineering services, building codes, budgeting, and scheduling.
Preferred: Licensed engineer (PE or EIT), CCM, PMP certifications
